HEADER.TITLE: The tones of compound nouns: body parts of animals, document 6 (verifications). Speaker F4, year 2008.

NOTE.message: Stereo audio signal collected from (i) a head-mounted Sennheiser microphone and (ii) a microphone placed on a table in front of the speaker. The audio signal from the head-mounted microphone (left channel) has some noise, perhaps electric noise from a faulty phantom power or interference from other signals: the microphone's cable is extremely thin.
Input tones (separated by a space): LM LH
Input tones (separated by a space): LM LH
Input tones (separated by a space): LM LH

This tone pattern, °L, was refused by the consultant in 2012. It was apparently a mistake due to the speaker's fatigue in the course of elicitation sessions using unusual materials. The correct (or, to say the least: the most common) pattern is MH#.
